intro: Tragoceros microglossum, commonly known as the small-lipped tragoceros, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, colorful flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale pink or white, and it blooms during the summer months. Tragoceros microglossum is often found in coastal and inland areas, thriving in regions with limited rainfall.
